  3501. Every brush you could possibly need is here and the case is extremely durable and the slots are versatile so over time, you can even use other brushes and they will fit in the slots.
  3502. I tested them on myself several days during the work week, and not only are they soft, but they haven't shed.
  3503. There are enough different shapes and sized to complete your look.

All Reviews

  1. Love love love these it was so worth it!!! Fast shipping! Great deal!
  2. Haven't used them yet but they look nice but have a very strong factory smell have to wash them first
  3. Several of these brushes have been useless for me (giant fan brush, lookin at you) but the eye brushes more than make up for this. Love the three different types of angled eye brushes. I use them for eyeshadow as eyeliner and to fill in my brows. This set is especially great for someone just starting out as it gives you a variety of brushes to experiment with before figuring out what works best for your routine.
  4. The brushes are absolutely usable but about the quality as the ones at Ulta. The only brushes that I really have issues with are the liner brushes, the handles are to long for me to get close enough to the mirror to see the detail work I am trying to do.<br /><br />I am keeping the set though, as the brushes wear out I will replace them one by one with a quality I prefer. This set lets me try different sizes of brushes are probably would never had bought individually to see if I like them.
  5. I am so impressed with the quality of the brushes, they are soft and good quality and of the same quality of Body shop brushes I paid $15 a brush for! I haven't had any shedding of the brushes (as of one wash) and they do the job. If you're looking for an excellent starter brush kit that isn't a waste of your money, this is the product for you!
  6. THEY ARE THE ONES I USE TO DO MY MAKEUP AND OTHER PEOPLE'S TOO AND THEY ARE GOOD FOR THE PRICE. ALL OF THEM WORK PERFECTLY, THEY ARE NEW AND THEY ALL SERVE THEIR PURPOSE. IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A CONVENIENT MAKE UP BRUSH SET THAT IS NOT THAT EXPENSIVE, YOU SHOULD BUY IT.
  7. My brushes had a lot of fall out especially the third one the flat top brush
  8. Works well according to my wife. I wasn't too impressed with the quality.
  9. I wanted to love these brushes as much as some of the rave reviews I've read posted here on amazon, I really did. I was thinking I'd be one of them. When I ordered them, I got so excited to get them. And they're not bad or anything, but they're not as good as everyone seems to be saying... There is a chance I got a bad batch, but after seeing more recent reviews on youtube and reading reviews about them on the coastal scents website and elsewhere, what I've realised is that this brush set reached its peak in quality from the time they came out in late 2011 (I think September 2011), until about a year and a half ago - which is when I noticed reviews about them started to get less consistently good. Like a fool, I waited too long to get them - I was really thinking it over for a long time (like two years!) whether or not I really needed them - and when I finally decided I should buy them, the quality went to pot in the meantime unfortunately, compared to what they were. Firstly, many of the brushes I have seem to have been made with a lot less hair in them than they were previously made with. Most notably the large fan, small duo-fibre round powder brush, the angle blush brush, and concealer are much less dense. The small round powder brush in particular seems to almost not even be there, it doesn't have many hairs in it in the first place, compared to videos I've seen of youtube beauty vloggers who have reviewed the same set. The other annoying thing about the brushes is that most of the eye brushes haven't been trimmed correctly, and even one or two of the bigger face ones have strange stray hairs in some spots. And some reviewers have mentioned shedding - I've experienced this the most specifically with the angle blush brush and the dark pointed blender - but almost all the natural fibre eye brushes have shed at least a little bit. What can I say? I'm disappointed. I believed the hype and based on that I bought the set. I know some people who've reviewed thisset say it's much more than just a beginner's set, but I can't agree. If most of the sets are of the same quality as what I've experienced mine to be, I'm sure no professional makeup artist would be raving about it. It's perfectly usable and adequate for a beginner, when you consider the price, but it's laughable to be considered as MAC replacement or even anything close. On a positive note, the case is very nice, and even when some of the brushes begin to die on me, I can certainly replace them with better quality ones over time. I've had them for about a month and I've been consistently using and washing them the whole time. I'll continue to use them until they all break down and die, but at the moment I'm also collecting better quality brushes already (like Real Techniques and most recently the Shany 24 pc. Pro Signature brush set which has much more consistently rave reviews than this one). It's too bad I'm all the way over in Europe otherwise I would have just returned them. I'm excited to be getting my Shany set which I recently ordered - it really does seem to be professional quality, and more like what this coastal scents one used to be. I just hope I'm not disappointed by that one like I was with this one. Because the Shany pro signature seems to be a fairly new set, released just late last year, I thought I'd jump on it this time instead of wondering and waiting until the quality goes down like with coastal scents- because that was also when coastal scents was at the top of its game too. I'll be leaving a review on that one after it arrives and I've used it for a while, just as I've done with this set. But in the meantime, if you're interested in this brush set as a beginner, go for it! I've heard on the American coastal scents site there's lots of sales and you might as well get the deal. But if you're a professional makeup artist or a more experienced makeup user, this set is perhaps not what it used to be if you're already used to good, professionalquality brushes.
  10. I got this brush set because I didn't have any brushes and I wanted to start use them to expand my knowledge of makeup application. This kit has almost every kind of brush that most people use for every day makeup style, plus some extras to play around with. However, you do get what you pay for as far a brushes are concerned, if you are super serious about it, it is better that you invest in better quality brushes. Higher quality is better for the health of your skin in the long run. Not everyone has the funds to purchase high quality brushes and this is a decent alternative as well as a way to transition if you don't know exactly what you are looking for. I would recommend this brush set for a short term beginner brush set.
  11. These brushes are everything everyone has said and more. Extremely soft, shed only a little*, high-quality makeup brushes in every size and configuration you will ever need. Even my makeup snob daughter was impressed. I am ordering another set for her so she will stop using mine! *At first I said they don't shed but then the black blush brush started shedding :( The natural bristle brushes seem better in that regard. Still love these brushes for the price!
  12. Love them! They make my makeup so flawless and smooth looking. Best brushes ever!
  13. I've had this brush set for months now, so I've gotten a chance to try all the brushes in the set. At first, I was absolutely in love with this set. The brushes are soft, decent quality makeup brushes. The eye brushes are perfectly fine, even after they're washed a few times. In contrast, the larger face brushes began to shed like CRAZY after I had been washing them for a few months. Specifically the flat top stippling brush and the flat foundation brush(which I use and wash the most). They're shedding so badly that they don't apply as well as they used to, and they're less dense. I plan on buying more, better quality face brushes. I still liked the set, but they weren't made to last.
  14. Love these brushes...still soft and no lost bristles, something that used to happen to me with my old set from Bare Minerals. I've washed the brushes several times now and they are like brand new. Great product, great price.
  15. I find it very workable, The quality is pliable, the variety is good for the different purposes. I think it will last longer than the<br />32 brush set. I have to clean every brush after each use, and I do think that is a wear on the brushes.
  16. I've been experimenting with new makeup techniques, so I needed more brushes that had different purposes. The case that they come with is great too. You can easily find what brush you need. I hardly ever have any fallout from the brushes, and they are very soft. These are great brushes for anyone that's just getting into makeup.

I honestly prefer the synthetic and these did it for me big time. also find a set that has all different brushes not 3 or 4 of the same one lol The giant powder brushes in here are bomb! This set is super reasonable on price considering you get all the important brushes you need. Great quality thanks amazon!

  37. These brushes are very comparable to sigma. These brushes do the job. It gives you a wide range of amazing quality eye brushes! I won't be buying any other eye brushes for a while now... I think I'm set to go! :) The face brushes are also very soft and compact. The big duo fiber brush reminds me a lot of the Sigma f50, except it's a lot more dense and compact for pressing in your foundation. Overall I would definitely recommend this set, it's great for people starting out with makeup especially. It pretty much gives you every brush you need. I was also very impressed with the brush roll. There is a strong chemical smell when you first get it, but after a few days it airs out. People seemed to think that was a huge problem, but it goes away after a while you guys.. I didn't find that to be a problem. The face brushes are great for liquid foundation, cream foundation, powders, highlighters, etc. Pretty much anything. You can't beat the price, what a steal! I won't be buying any brushes for a while, this is overwhelming! :)

  90. I am a makeup artist, and although I have pro memberships with several popular makeup companies, I'm not a brush snob. I was looking for new brushes for my kit for a couple of jobs I have coming up, and was allllll over the internet searching. I purposely avoided my pro sites and was just going to use them as a last resort b/c of the cost per brush. One of my makeup friends told me about Coastal Scents and when I saw them on Amazon, I had to check them out. I paid the $34.95, and couldn't be happier. I tested them on myself several days during the work week, and not only are they soft, but they haven't shed. I will update this when I wash them, but I love them so far. I appreciate that practically every makeup need is met in this set. The fan brush is huge, so it would be more appropos for dusting highlight on the body and not the face. The eye brushes are soft and not scratchy, and the same goes for the powder/blush brushes. The only downside is that the bag has a bit of an odor, and if you are sensitive to smells, that may be a problem. I believe it to be just the bag b/c I haven't had any reactions to the brushes when they're near my face. If you plan to use the bag, it may be worth airing out on the porch or patio.<br /><br />I ordered two more sets of these brushes b/c I've noticed that sometimes when I order from Amazon, after I buy, the item price goes up. I was able to get that fantastic price again. I highly recommend this set.

  106. Pros: 1) Quantity, multiple sizes for similar task brushes, 2) natural and synthetic brush heads, soft to the touch (hand/fingers), dense. 3) The flat buffer brush is lovely. It is of very good quality, and several of the larger brushes all come with brush head protectors too - nice bonus.<br /><br />Cons: 1) For me - too many eye shadow brushes (as I keep my eye shadow pretty simple for work), 2) the powder brush - synthetic hair is NOT soft on the face...Every time I try to use it shorter stiff bristles &#34;scratch&#34; against my face and I'm barely touching my face with it. I've tried it several times, washed several times - still rough. I will not use this one again. 3) The foundation brush (flat head - like a larger concealer brush) is NOT soft on the face either. The length of the hairs are shorter than other brand foundation brushes thus making it scratchy on the face. Even when I use it just to &#34;pat&#34; on foundation, I feel the hairs poking into my face. I'll be sticking to the one I already have - longer hairs - not bristle jabbing.

  145. The quality of these brushes is incredible for the price. The bristles are so soft and they're not flimsy like some cheaper brushes. This is a great kit for beginners that are just starting out with makeup and don't want to break bank. The case has a foul odor, but that's to be expected and it fades after a couple of days. I love that it comes with brush guards. The brushes should be washed before use, I personally recommend using Parian Spirit. It is the best brush cleanser I've ever bought, it removes all makeup from the brushes as well as gel liner and lash glue, which if you use any of those you know they're difficult to get off the brush. It also leaves your brushes smelling so nice, it's a citrus like smell. The fan brush is not as thick as I'd like it to be for highlighting, but it's good for wiping away fall out. I wish the brushes came with number to help identify the brush like brushes from MAC. There's no lip brush or tapered highlighting brush, but I you can buy those separately. I recommend Sigma or Sedona Lace for good quality brushes without having to pay a lot. Overall, it's a great product for a great price. It gets the job done very well.

The whole set, actually, has been amazing to use. I never realized how lovely make up goes on when you have a quality brush set. I especially love the way my eye shadows look when applied and blended with these brushes. They hairs on the various brushes are soft and feel so luxurious when they touch my skin.<br /><br />I admit that in the beginning, I felt a little daunted by all the different kinds of brushes in this set, so I printed the photo of them that's posted in the product info. Based on the caption explaining the function of these brushes, I labeled the thumbnail image of each brush. I keep this in a drawer in my bathroom and refer to it if I forget which brush does what.<br /><br />I also wash these brushes weekly, and they clean up well and look great after they're dry. I did notice a few stray hairs that fell off a couple of the brushes during cleaning, but it only happened once and didn't recur the other times I've washed them. The case they came in is lovely, too. It looks nice, protects my brushes nicely, and is fairly easy to keep clean. It rolls up into a mostly flat rectangle shape that fits easily into my large make up case.<br /><br />In terms of the ordering and shipping process, everything went smoothly. I received the product in good condition, the brush set was just what I expected based in the product description, and it shipped here in about five days.

  170. I was very surprised with how much I love these brushes! I am very passionate about makeup and do some professionally on the side, so I wasn't to purchase a new, but reasonably priced, set of brushes. There were so many positive reviews for the Coastal Scents 22 Piece Brush Set that I just went for it and boy am I glad that I did!<br /><br />This brush set contains 22 brushes: 10 made from Pony hair, 4 made from synthetic hair, 4 made from nylon, 2 from fiber hair, 1 from goat hair, and 1 is made of rubber. All of the brushes are extremely soft and look/feel very high quality. I recommend, as does Coastal Scents, washing the brushes before use. Very little hair came out during washing and very little excess hair has come off since. I absolutely love the case. It folds up nicely containing all of the brushes and there was even a little bit of room for me to add some of my favorite single brushes (from other companies) to this set. I did notice a little bit of a smell with the case, it's not too bad but just a kind of unpleasant &#34;plastic-y&#34; scent. I'm not sure how to get rid of this even after wiping it down a few times.<br /><br />My only real complaint about this brush set is that these brushes are not numbered. I think they could have really 'upped' the value of these brushes by adding numbers (like MAC and Stigma). In the product info, Coastal Scents lists the brushes by numbers (1-22) so that is how I will refer to them in this review.<br /><br />My favorite face brushes are #2, #3, and #5. I use #2, (Powder Buffer), on my neck and decolletage to blend my foundation. I love #3, (Round Powder) for contouring and highlighting. Its bristles are looser so it does not apply light and dark powders in a very concentrated way, which I like. And #5, (Angle Blush) is awesome for blush but it adds color in a concentrated way so only use a little powder at a time and really blend.<br /><br />My favorite eye brow brushes are #20 and #21. I use #20, (Large liner/brow), for lining up the shape of my eyebrow as well as filling it in with my brow powder. I love #21, (Medium liner/brow), for lining my concealer around the eyebrow to help shape it and give it a nice, clean look.<br /><br />My favorite eye shadow brushes are # 9, #10, #13, and #14. For applying eyeshadow, especially multiple colors, I love using #14 (Detail Shadow) and #13 (Medium Shadow) for my inner eye. I then use #9 (Blender) to add accent colors, and #10 (Doe Foot Blender) is great for contouring and adding darker colors to your eye lid.<br /><br />I think that overall this is a terrific value even if you only use half of the brushes. I definitely recommend this for beginning professional make-up artists on a tight budget as well as others who are passionate about makeup (=for lining up the shape of my eyebrow as well as filling it in with my brow powder. I love #21, (Medium liner/brow), for lining my concealer around the eyebrow to help shape it and give it a nice, clean look.<br /><br />My favorite eye shadow brushes are # 9, #10, #13, and #14. For applying eyeshadow, especially multiple colors, I love using #14 (Detail Shadow) and #13 (Medium Shadow) for my inner eye. I then use #9 (Blender) to add accent colors, and #10 (Doe Foot Blender) is great for contouring and adding darker colors to your eye lid.<br /><br />I think that overall this is a terrific value even if you only use half of the brushes. I definitely recommend this for beginning professional make-up artists on a tight budget as well as others who are passionate about makeup (=

Some brushes do shed a hair or two occasionally but that doesn't bother me. The only brush missing from the set I think is essential is a tapered blending brush (Sigma E40/MAC 224 dupe). You can never have too many blending brushes.<br /><br />As for the case, I don't use it, not even for traveling because I find it inconvenient to put all the brushes into each slot. I just throw all of my brushes into a separate makeup bag and I'm good to go. I don't remember if they had a chemical smell or not when I first received them but even if they did, it was overshadowed by my excitement for the quality and quantity of brushes I got.<br /><br />I loved these babies so much, I bought two additional sets when they were on sale to give to my sister and mom. You can't go wrong with these.

  260. I love that this set includes a round buffer brush and tapered contouring brush! Brush sets rarely contain both and I was really happy to find a set that finally had both. If you don't like the feel of synthetic brushes, then this probably isn't for you because roughly half of the brushes are synthetic. I personally like that every brush has its own slot in the case. I took out some brushes that I don't use and replaced them with a brow pencil, eyeliner, lash comb, etc. There's also a zippered compartment where the fan brush is, which I love because I can put my mascara, Q-tips, and makeup wipes. Overall, it's a fantastic set for a price you can't beat.
  261. exactly what I needed!!!! perfect perfect all perfect! wish i could give this 6 stars lol high quality and the brushes are amazing and very soft and stable texture!!

  263. Wife loved them! Says they're soft and quality made. Easy to use and a great addition to add to her makeup collection.
  264. I am somewhat of a brush snob, but not really. I look for brushes that perform well and are worth the price. I have owned my Bobbi Brown brushes for nearly 2 decades and have never been sorry for the investment. They still perform WELL, but know that I take care of my brushes, regardless of cost.<br /><br />After seeing reviews for a variety of Coastal Scents products, including the buffing brush, I decided to throw caution into the wind and purchase the 22 pc brush set (I really didn't need all 22 brushes...seriously...I have WAY too many brushes for someone who is NOT a makeup artist).<br /><br />The brushes came in a really cool brush roll. It has an interesting odor, but nothing repulsive. I am sure that it will dissapate over time. The brushes themselves have no noticable odor. As a matter of fact, my recent MAC brushes (from the Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale) had a detectable odor.<br /><br />So far, the brushes I have tried have performed as well as my high-end brushes. I have not noticed any hair loss after washing the brushes. I cannot say the same for my BE brushes. I can see taking this on my business trips instead of having a mish-mash of different types of brushes from different manufacturers.<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this brush set for both the novice and experienced make-up users. If you wonder how to use each brush, be sure to check out videos on the web for how to use them.<br /><br />The only thing that I would have liked to see was the brush number on each of the brushes. It's not like they are trying to hide from the paparazzi, you know? They have Coastal Scents embossed on the handles, but not the brush number. Not sure why that is. That's basically my only complaint...and it's not even a complaint. More like a recommendation to the company.<br /><br />You won't regret this purchase. Just remember to take care of your brushes, regardless of their price. If you take care of them, and they are properly constructed, they will provideyears of good service.

The brush case has an additonal storage compartment right underneath the fan brush that can store additional items if needed., The brush pockets are wide enough to store up to two brushes (depending on the brush handle width of course) at the same time.<br /><br />I do suggest cleaning your brushes before your first use (I use a 99% anti bacterial soap with a olive oil to keep the brush bristles from drying out, while i clean them under luke warm water), although they're well secured and glued into the handle, I advise to always keep water from entering the handle by cleaning them with the bristles facing downward. I did notie that while cleaning the brushes a few bristles came off (as to be excpected) but nothing too alarming or outside of the &#34;norm&#34;. Other bruses seemed to have a black dye or powder that came out while cleaning them for the first time, as if the brush had been previously used on black eyeshadow or something.   361. I received these brushes from my husband as an anniversary gift. He knew I had been looking an extremely long time for a brush set; and well, the brushes I was looking at were just a bit out of our price range. I was excited when I got these because they were basically what I was looking for (the only thing missing was a flat top kabuki brush). Fast forward three months later, one of the brush's tops came off. It looked like the glue wasn't strong enough to keep it on the handle. Fast forward another three months, another top came off. I glued both of them back onto the handle, but I'm sure the rest will do that because they're a cheap brush set. One thing I don't like at all is the blush brush. Whenever I use it, parts of the bristles sit on my face. I have to pick them off of my cheeks one by one. That gets super annoying. I would say the best brush in this set is the fan brush for highlighter. Some of the smaller shadow brushes are nice, but if you're looking for a really good brush set to last you a while and you're an advanced makeup artist or do your makeup everyday (like me), then you probably want to look for an alternative set. I plan on saving up a little more money and slowly but surely trading out each of these brushes with another brand.

  383. WARNING!<br />Some of these brushes are NOT worth the money you're paying for them. Some of them work great. For example the face angled brush and eye rubber smudger are completely useless. The face angled brush loses its shape right after you first wash it, not only that but it sheds like CRAZY (as well as the second brush to the right) it has a very unpleasant smell to it. Almost like horse hair. Once it's dry and ready to use it performs poorly since the bristles are no longer in the shape they were when they arrived. I am VERY disappointed with some of these brushes. However, there are some that I really like and am happy to have bought. I would say 40% of these brushes shedded when I washed them. Although most of these come handy when applying your makeup, I find the ones made of pony hair very hard to work with since the bristles literally SUCK! BE AWARE OF WHAT YOU'RE BUYING. If none of this bothers you, girl go right ahead and buy this set, but if you're constantly having to do people's makeup and wash your brushes just as much as I do then this is only worth half the money.

It seemed to have a ton of great reviews, and lets be honest.. I was super excited as soon as the set arrived at my door. The material is really sturdy, and the brushes were all wrapped in plastic and organized perfectly, and there is even a zipper pocket. There was a slight plastic smell when I first opened it, but it has gone away since I've been using it. The brushes are soft and seem to be great quality. All brushes are not made of the same material.. It seems that someone really took the time to think out the best brushes to put in the set. There is a great range of brushes from a fan brush, foundation brush, contour brush, all the eyeshadow brushes you could ever need, pencil brushes, and even a small felt-tip brush. There is little bristle fallout when using these brushes, and they hold up well so far.<br /><br />I am thrilled with this set. Seriously, go ahead and buy it.   477. If you are interested in having a wide range of brushes and not paying out the nose for each one, this is a lovely kit to get you started.<br /><br />There are some stand-out brushes. The foundation brush works well with both foundation and application of concealer to larger area; it created extremely smooth results with the products I was using. The flat, stiff, longer eyeshadow brush was great for packing on product to the lid and was large enough to apply a lot of product but small enough to keep control of where I was applying it.<br /><br />There are multiple sizes of eyeliner brushes and I have been very, very pleased with how easy they are to work with. They create smooth lines and are not too hard or soft.<br /><br />The softer fluffier eyeshadow brushes get the job done, but I almost wish they were a bit longer so that blending was easier/quicker. They are still very versatile and have multiple sizes.<br /><br />The large fan brush is a bit larger and softer than I am used to with fan brushes - it's still useful for things like wiping away fallout and excess or applying soft halos or highlighter to large areas, but for those looking for more control or the ability to apply more product might look to replace or add a different fan brush to this set.<br /><br />There are a couple notable brushes not included in this set - the brush I thought was a stippling brush from the picture turned out to be more of a highlight applier (although a good one, I tried to use it for stippling as an experiment and it is a very solid bunch of bristles and applies too much product to use for an airbrushed foundation look) and there is nothing that I could use as a lip brush. I still highly recommend getting this and adding or changing out whatever brushes you might need to suit your individual interests because it's a great way to plunge in to owning/using a variety of make-up brushes, and the case holds everything together nicely.<br /><br />I am very pleased with this purchase.

I put it out on the balcony and it was gone withing couple of hours. The brushes themsleves dont carry that odor. I also washed them with mild soap and water and lay flat to dry. The bristles do not shed, as mentioned in previous review.. The reason i gave 4 stars, i wish the set came with explanation for what each brush must be used for. ( i wouldnt know what half of them are used for). Other than that a very nice quality set for the price.
  617. These brushes are pretty good quality. I don't think I like these brushes as well as the Sigma brushes but they are still pretty good brushes. I haven't had any issues with them so far.
  618. I LOVE MY BRUSHES!!! The flat top brush is my favorite, work just as great as the high end brushes.

  649. I was hesitant to buy these brushes based on some of the reviews, but since the price is really good for the amount of brushes you are receiving, I decided \\"what the heck\\" and bought them. I must say I am glad I did. It is possible that the manufacturer made some changes due to past reviews, or my expectations were low enough that I was expecting so smell a chemical plant and be poked harshly in the face, but I was pleasantly surprised when I opened them and found neither a horrid smell or stiff bristles. I have washed them already and the shedding only occurred on a few brushes and was minimal (a hair or two). The brushes are very soft (Note: I do not usually use super nice, professional grade brushes). The eye brushes do a good job picking up eye shadow and the blenders seem to do a good job blending. I have not tested all the face brushes, but the angled brush and the big powder brush are nice (though, I did feel a little poking with the big powder brush). If you are not in the market for professional-grade, expensive brushes but would like to increase your brush collection so you can broaden your make-up skills, I recommend these brushes. As far as the roll goes, there was a slight odor but really slight. I had to put my nose up to the roll to smell it (and I have a pretty excellent sense of smell). So again, I either got a really good batch of brushes and case or the manufacturer decided to make some changes.
  650. I purchased a Sigma set a few years back and loved them. My Sigma brushes were twice as expensive, half the number of brushes and didn't come with a case. Half of them lasted about two years. I was thinking that these would be a big downgrade from Sigma, but couldn't really afford to replace all my brushes. However, this is a really good set! I assuming they will not last as long, but I am still amazed to get a so many high quality brushes for such a low price. I washed them right after I got them. and the bristles seemed very strong and soft. None of them fell out during the wash, which has happened to my biggest Sigma brushes since the beginning. My first test of them resulted in a beautiful makeup day, and I am super satisfied. The case that these come with is great too!!

  668. **UPDATE**3/17/13<br />I washed these brushes again as I do every week or two depending on how many times I used them and the worst thing happened. For those of you not familiar with the terms of the brush names the simplistic way is the flat large kabuki or stippling brush completely caved in and all the bristles in the center fell into the brush and out of the top. The same happened with rounded kabuki handle brush last week. This goes to show the glue is not strong and as careful as I am with not getting them wet deep into the handle and drying them properly this still occurred. Not only that but in 3 months of use the performance of these brushes have declined. They don't seem pick up as much product or lay it as evenly. I use professional products for cleaning and conditioning as well as brush guards to reshape them while drying. I did really love these brushes. But the shedding that started after a few washes has really destroyed the quality of these brushes. I truly had high hopes for these. I rated them 4 stars and for lower price and in the low mid grade line of brushes would have gave them a solid 5. Now simply a 2 at best because they did last 3 months for 35 dollars. Such a huge disappointment. My Bobbi Brown and MAC brushes have lasted 10 years without a single issue. My old 8-10 year old MAC brushes were prior to Estae Lauder buying them out where as after the buy out I have gotten 5 or do years of use. My Sigma brushes the ones I purchased a year ago and 3 years ago are going strong. I am going to spend the extra 30-60 on purchasing Sedona Lace brushes many wonderful artists I know and work with have been raving about them. Equally comparing to Sigma and some as great as MAC for far less. I am truly heartbroken these did not last.<br />**END UPDATE**<br />This is a good brush set. This being said if you are expecting a product with the same structure and quality as Mac or Sigma you are barking up the wrong tree. But if you are looking for a personal use decent quality brush set this is for you. I'm a makeup artist and I have pretty much every brand and brush under the sun but I also can't help but purchase anything new or that I simply don't have out on the market. You never know when you will come across a gem. I have multiples being as I always need 3-5 clean and ready to go sets being as washing and drying will take up to 2 days and I don't ever want that to interfere with clients. I wash and condition my brushes not just sterilize them a quick sterilization can have the brushes ready in hours but it can also destroy the brush if done every time and long term. I would not use these on my clients. They deserve and expect the highest level of quality and application. The thing is I am VERY fond of this set for personal use. Some brushes I won't ever use and others I'm using daily. But for around a buck a brush it's so worth it and with the ones I gave away from this set or still equals out to a little over $3 a brush factoring in just the ones I kept. I have single brushes and sets from sephora I spent over $125 a set and $20 for individual brushes that I prefer these brushes over those. I haven't had any shedding on the natural brushes and minimal on the synthetic brushes. The large fan brush and the angled blush brush had shed the most but nothing serious. I've had these for about a month and washed them a dozen times. They seem to be well constructed the glue is still very much intact. If you are looking for a great priced personal use brush set this is right for you. If you are expecting Mac and Sigma quality from this set I really don't know how you could expect anything to perform to that level at such a low price. I haven't been able to find anything that can compete with those brands in my 10 years of artistry and makeup addiction. This is a great beginner set, rotation set, and personal use set. I do wish they were labeled but they only have the brand name on them. The case did have a factory odor I let them air out overnight and the smell went away. It wasn't anything terrible reminded me of the new car smell something straight from the factory. All in all it's worth the money just don't go in expecting Mac or Sigma.

  676. I must say that I'm a bit of a make up snob and brushes happen to b the thing I like to collect. The majority of my brushes are from Sephora, MAC, Bobbi Brown, and Chanel(love their eye brushes). Theses can get quite pricey so lately I've been branching out and trying lesser priced tools and products. I was also looking for those I can use with mixing mediums to avoid the possibility of damaging my others.<br />There r a few things that are different but In order to be fair I take that into consideration in this review. The main differences i see are: They aren't as weighted, some aren't as dense mainly the eyeshadows however that doesn't seem to affect application and its a very minute amount. I had some initial shedding(minimal) from a few-the ones I remember are the angled blush and the flat bronzer..and it was an acceptable amount-3-4 hairs tops.. I've had more shedding from brushes I paid $40 and up for! Also some of the bristle aren't cut to the exact shape but again only 1 or 2. Yes, there is an initial smell but I only noticed it on the brush roll. And once added a little shoe deodorizer I aired it out over night it was gone. The brushes did not have a residual smell. Can't judge longevity at this point.<br />All in all This brush set is fantastic! All of the brushes are very soft but still pick up product well. I absolutely love the duo fiber brushes and I haven't seen those particular shapes in any other high end brand. Especially the extra large powder-which I use for BB cream.<br />I've been wanting various sizes of eyeshadow bullets/pencils and this set gives quite a few. Many of the shapes are &#34;dupes&#34; of higher end brands. I use them with cream and powder-I tend to ignore the &#34;rules&#34; and they work well-just mist with either a toner or setting spray 1st. Oh the brushes # 17 and #18 (a short shader and a bullet crease)actually look and feel like goat fibers to me. Which I happen to like.<br />If you give these a fair chance I think you'db really happy with them. I am!

  723. I bought this set because several blogs raved about the quality of Coastal Scents was comparable to pricier brands. Although I didn't notice a strong odor like some of the other reviewers, I did find the quality of the bristles for at least 50% of the brushes to be very poor. I do like the large and small stippling brushes, the foundation brush, and the eyeliner brush very much, but the regular shadow brushes don't pick up powder as well as my high-end brushes. I've had this set for over a year and most of the brushes have gotten pretty shaggy and/or started missing bristles.<br /><br />All in all, this is a decent starter set and the 5 or 6 good brushes are still worth the price of the set.

Of all 22 brushes I only had 1 (yes one) fiber fallout, and I've used them a few times and they have not lost any hairs at all. All of the brushes are amazingly soft, despite some of their densities, and some of them are quite dense. I love the face brushes. The eye brushes are amazing as well. If you can think of a look you can make it happen.<br />As far as how they compare to mac or sigma brushes I don't know because I've never used them.   751. At the price, this brush set provides tremendous value. Other said almost everything that is important about this product. There are several things about this product that stand out to me. As a whole the set is incomplete, but this is a \\"brush set\\" not a complete makeup kit. Reviewing only the brushes it actually came with that I use, this is a fabulous value product. However, the kit is missing several brush types that I use, so it is by no means a complete brush set for me.<br />On what it came with, some of my thoughts are:<br />1) the synthetic angle brushes are better than almost anything else I tried for gel eyeliner. They are thin and stiff, the two features required for a sharp line. I prefer these to my 266 brushes for gel liner.<br />2) The big angle blending brush thing is very nice, and just as good as alternatives from other brands.<br />3) the fan brush is completely functional for applying powder highlight, and works well for that. I'm not sure what else I would use it for.<br />4) it comes with a variety of eye shadow brushes in at least 3 sizes, which is nice.<br />5) there is a variety of eye blending brushes in the set, however none are a good alternative to a puffy blending brush like,for example a 217 (or its other brand alternatives).<br /><br />the set lacks a large puffy brush for applying powder like colored or setting powder<br /><br />I'm not sure what the flat top white$black brush is useful for. It is not a replacement for a good stippling brush like the 130 and its alternatives.<br /><br />There is not a puffy eye blending brush (like a 217 or its similar alternatives). In fact, all the blending brushes in the kit are stiff. I would prefer to have a range of eye blending brushes rather than the same style in slightly different sizes

I'd say if your getting past the beginner stage in makeup this is an amazing pack for anybody looking for the right about of brushes. there arent too many and i can see having a use for every one of them. they make doing ur makeup so enjoyable haha. i went through all the reviews and decided why not. and im so happy with this purchase!<br /><br />why these brushes over others- first i was looking at a really cute set of about 15 or so pink brushes with white hair. then i realized that they might be cute but the reviews werent steller plus there wasnt a good variety of brushes. so i kept looking. i couldnt find any in my price range that had a good variety, good reviews and good quality. then i found these! first i was very impressed but all the info they give u. they tell u how to clean them (which i found super helpful) and the purpose and number of each and every brush with a close up of the head of each brush. i was very impressed. the deal (while i was looking for 20$ or so--im cheep ik) was still very good since it was coming to about a dollar 50 per brush. i saw every brush i ever wanted in this pack. and let me tell you the qaulity is priceless. the other sets i was looking at either had questionable reviews or just from looking at the picture didnt have good quality.<br /><br />the legendary smell- well for most people who gave this review less than a 5 they talked about the smell. so i fugred i would adress it to keep u from questioning it. first off, the plastic bag then the lether case came in was the thing with the smell. the lether case didnt really absorb much of the smell unles u put ur nose right up to it. the brushes didnt get any of the smell whatsoever and its not even there anymore after a day of not being in the plastic bag it was shipped in. i honestly dont know why people would write a bad review because of the smell since it goes away within 5 hours of being out of its shipped package. honestly its a processed item, get over the fact if u put ur nose right up to it seconds after being out of its shipped container that it has a slight odor. plus the odor just smelled like plastic. not anything gross and it went away and the brushes never even got the smell.<br /><br />the brushes- i really do love them. quickly though just to tell you i think it is great that most of them are black with white tips or a darker color. having the black at the bottom is perfect for not showing any of the dirt while the white tips at the top show u how much makeup u have on them..<br /><br />cleanup- it recommended cleaning them once before first use. i have been awful about cleaning my brushes in the past but i promised myself i would clean these good so they would stay fresh and nice. i cleaned them how they said to (warm water and soap/ brush cleaner) then let them out to dry. don't freakout if some loose bristles come out the first wash (its completely normal). the face brushes took over night to dry (which shouldn't be a surprise considering how many bristles they have) and the smaller brushes took maybe less than 2 hours to dry. I'd say just wash them in the evening when u wont need them again til morning them let them dry out on a towel with the fan on. it says to put brush guards on them but i don't have any and they looked the same as wen i first got them wen they were dry so brush guards are not necessary.<br /><br />applying makeup- the makeup goes on perfectly ! there is a brush for ever type of makeup (liquid powder etc.) and they are all able to have liquid products used on them.<br /><br />one con-i just wish the brushes were numbered. &#34;coastal scents&#34; is on every brush and i just wish the number could be too just so i could feel more professional but i really don't care its just one thing i would love.<br /><br />i really hope this helped. this is the first review ive bothered to write so i hope it cleared some stuff up!<br /><br />-jms

  873. I washed them before use as recommended.All natural hair brushes in this set shed a lot.That would be 10 eyeshadow brushes and angle brush (5th from the left).Bigger brushes shed 20+ hairs smaller ones just a few.After they dried shedding continued.I dabbed brushes on a lint roller to remove loose hairs and posted a picture,to give you an idea how much.<br />I think shedding stopped for now.I will update review if it changes.<br /><br />Have to mention I got two of these sets, one for me and one to gift and both shed the same.So I do not understand all the raving about how brushes do not shed.I obviously did not get defective set since both perform similar.I washed and rinsed them by swirling on a clean plate,used E.L.F antibacterial brush shampoo and dried them hanging with bristles down,so water does not get into ferrule.<br /><br />Now the good part.All of the brushes do what they supposed to very well.They pick up good amount of product and apply it to my liking.Synthetic brushes shed very little or not at all.Most are very full and dense.<br />Large powder buffer is my favorite. I use it for liquid foundation.It is so full it takes over 24 hrs. to dry.I had to get second brush like that to be able to use it every day.One sold individually by Coastal Scents is $14.95.It is similar but even more dense and has slightly shorter bristles.I also like flat top buffer,mostly for powders but can be used for liquid makeup too.I would buy this set just for two buffer brushes and foundation brush, that I wish was bigger,but stil a good brush I use a lot,love it for BB cream.<br /><br />Case has faint chemical smell that goes away.In my opinion, it is something to be expected with anything made of pvc.I had brush set from BH cosmetics that smelled absolutely toxic for weeks, so this is nothing.<br /><br />Not the softest bristles I ever touched, but better than I expected from cheap brushes.<br /><br />There are few I would skip.Small duo fiber one they call round powder(3rd from the left) is very skinny,not my favorite.Pretty much identical liner brushes in 3 sizes I do not care for.Many similar eyeshadow brushes in different sizes, would be good for makeup artist, as there are different eye sizes to work with, but there are too many for personal use.Not the worst thing to complain about )))<br /><br />It would be good to have names of brushes stamped on a handle, especially since Amazon does not have them listed at all. You can go to coastalscents.com and print it out,they have detailed description of every brush.<br /><br />I think you can not get a better variety of decent brushes for $30.(3rd from the left) is very skinny,not my favorite.Pretty much identical liner brushes in 3 sizes I do not care for.Many similar eyeshadow brushes in different sizes, would be good for makeup artist, as there are different eye sizes to work with, but there are too many for personal use.Not the worst thing to complain about )))<br /><br />It would be good to have names of brushes stamped on a handle, especially since Amazon does not have them listed at all. You can go to coastalscents.com and print it out,they have detailed description of every brush.<br /><br />I think you can not get a better variety of decent brushes for $30.

  889. For the price there isn't a better set on the market. The only thing you need is a 219 pencil brush from Mac because those just can't be duped. Other than that this is all you'll ever need and I'm a makeup artist.
  890. Let me start off by saying that I am NOT a makeup brush snob... most of my brushes that I have are from the drugstore, and the highest quality ones I have are the Sephora brand ones -- I generally don't buy high-end brushes or spend a lot of money on them... so I knew these weren't going to be amazing quality, but honestly this set is reeeeally bad.<br /><br />When I first opened the box these came in, I was met with a STRONG chemical smell. It was kind of like a plastic-y, vinyl smell, or some kind of chemical, I really don't know for sure, but it was very strong and awful. I opened up the case and laid it out, to let all the brushes air out for two days. The smell was much lighter after that, but still kind of there.<br /><br />Then I started playing around with the brushes... I noticed right away that some of them seemed dirty. I could see traces of dust or powder of some kind, like they had been sitting on a shelf and accumulating dust for a long time. It's possible it might've even been eyeshadow instead of dust? Were these brushes pre-owned? I sure hope not.<br /><br />I also noticed right away that mostly all of the brushes shed. Some shedding is not a deal breaker for me, but three of the eyeshadow brushes in particular shed SO RIDICULOUSLY MUCH that I immediately just threw them away. The amount of shedding honestly made them unusable. These were some of the more fluffy eyeshadow brushes, meant for blending, so that was really disappointing, because those are the ones I would have used more often. That's three brushes in the trash, outright.<br /><br />Before actually using the brushes on my face, I decided to wash them first, since I was worried about the chemical smell, and dust/powder traces I found on some of the brushes. When the brushes got wet, the chemical smell got stronger. But by the time they dried, the chemical smell was thankfully gone.<br /><br />As far as actual application of makeup goes... the quality is really hit-or-miss. The best ones in the set are the face brushes, particularly the flat top kabuki, foundation, dual fiber, and concealer brushes. Those are actually pretty good quality. The thin angled eyeliner brushes are pretty good as well. However, most of the eyeshadow brushes pretty much suck. I mean, three of them shed so much they were unusable and I trashed them right away, and the rest are too thin/flimsy to really control the product you're putting on your eyes -- they end up not picking up enough product, or just making a mess. They are not dense enough.<br /><br />In general, the &#34;fluffier&#34; brushes (like the blush and eyeshadow blending brushes) in this set are terrible, whereas the stiffer, more dense brushes (like foundation and concealer brushes) are pretty good.<br /><br />Oh, and the leather case is extremely cheap. The snaps don't line up properly, so it's impossible to snap both of them shut at the same time, and EVERY time I open it, the fan brush immediately falls out (and sometimes a few others). That will probably go in the trash too, to be honest.<br /><br />The only reason I am not returning this for a refund is that I plan on keeping/using about 8 or 9 of the brushes. $32 for 9 decent brushes is still a good deal in my book, even though I had some problems with them. I would not recommend these to a friend, nor would I ever buy from Coastal Scents again though, sorry.
  891. I absolutely love this brush set and for a price that can't be beat! I did a lot of research and read reviews for what brush set to buy that was affordable and this is what I decided on. I'm so happy I did because they are easy to use and so easy to take when you travel. I didn't think I needed so many brushed but I found a use for almost all of them, lol. I have had no issues with a smell, bristles falling out, or anything breaking and I've had these for over 6 months.

They've been through dozens of uses and washes and look as good as the day that I bought them. The only brush I tossed right off the bat was the large fan brush, as it is too light to do much of anything with. The foundation and concealer brushes are fantastic, as are the shadow brushes. For instance, using the blush brush, even with the baked blush is difficult to apply on your cheeks. To be fair, I am not a make up artist so there may be user error in my part.   981. Edit: After several weeks of using and washing. No change in my review. There was some initial shedding from one or two brushes, but only during the first wash, since then, no issues. I would recommend getting a few brush guards, mainly for the blush brush, to help keep its shape while drying. Otherwise, still gong with fantastic for my review!<br /><br />I am in love with this brush set after only a few days of use. I will update this review after first wash, and maybe a few months of use.<br /><br />Out of the package, I will admit, there is a odor. However, the odor is more from the brush envelope holder than the brushes themselves.<br /><br />Onward to the brushes though....<br /><br />First, overall, the quality looks great. Better than you're going to get for any other brushes at this price point. There are was no immediate shedding like I have had with some cheaper brushes out of the package (*cough* ELF *cough). And the array of brushes is pretty fantastic.<br /><br />The fan brush.... I am not sure about this one yet. It isn't extraordinarily dense and the longer bristles feel a bit to flimsy to pick up and apply an appropriate amount of product, but then again you may want that in a fan brush because it theory you are using it for highlighting.<br /><br />The large round buffer/powder brush - OMG this brush is heaven on the face. It's soft and lovely. I think it could easily be used to apply liquid foundation, it feels a lot like the Real Techniques brush for that purpose. Easily my favorite brush in the collection and was worth the entire price of the set alone.<br /><br />Flat style buffer, this is great too. Supposedly good for liquid foundation, like the Sigma F80. It does a good job with that, the bristles are very dense. Much better than the Sonya Kashuk one from target that paid eighteen flippin dollar for on its own.<br /><br />The angled brush, wow is that soft for a goat hair brush! I am amazed! I thought I hated goat hair brushes but apparently I was just using bad goat hair brushes (*cough* ELF *cough*). Great for blush/contouring.<br /><br />Other face brushes, including the flat foundation brushes and concealer brushes are good too, although I don't use flat foundation brushes.<br /><br />The eye brushes - so many to choose from! The doe foot blender alone is great, I have never had one before and apparently I didn't know what I was missing! The only thing I was disappointed with here is that there wasn't a just plain nice sized c-shaped shadow brush and no fluffier crease brush. However, fortunately ELF does make those two decently in their Studio line, so jump over there and buy them if you want. The angled liner brushes are great too, and the varying sizes are a huge plus that many sets don't bother with.<br /><br />So to recap:<br /><br />Pros: Overall great quality, no shedding, nice selection, and the freaking price is outstanding<br />Cons: The smell of the packaging, the lack of C-shape shadow brush and fluffy blending brush<br /><br />I am really happy with this purchase. I recommend it to someone starting out with makeup looking to pick up everything at once. Otherwise, you'll end up like me, buying different cheaper brushes over a period of time and not being happy with them, then you'll just buy this set or something similar and end up putting all your old brushes in a drawer or travel case and it will have been a waste of money.<br /><br />If you're really serious about makeup, I would suggest looking at Sigma, but maybe buying these as a spare set down the road. I like having extra brushes for when my primary set is still wet from cleaning.

  1022. Love this brush set! Grabs, holds and applies products efficiently, is soft, didn't shed when washed, shipped quickly and has enough brushes to do a whole face. The only brush I had a prob with is the angled blush brush, it shed after it dried from washing and I was being exceedingly gentle. Not every brush needs to be densely packed and they understood this with their blending brushes. The brushes that needed to be densely packed were. The brushes only have Coastal Scents written on them and I thought beginners could benefit from having the name of the brush actually on the brush instead of on the packaging. The carrying case seems sturdy and not flimsy which is important. Overall I was very very pleased with these brushes and would recommend them to a beginner or an experienced makeup user

When I first opened the package there weren't any strong smells, the brushes were all intact, soft and I liked the case. I don't have a problem with them shedding, they apply color evenly. I wash them about twice a month with baby shampoo and condition them. The only problem that I've run into with these brushes is that where the handle meets the brush head, it keeps disconnecting. I was washing a few and the handle popped out. I just pushed it back in, but I can tell it's loose. I'm not sure if I got some water in the seam and it loosened the glue? But overall this set is pretty good quality and you get plenty of useful brushes for the price.
